lead_paragraph: Leandro Barbosa, the leading scorer in the FIBA Americas tournament, scored 21 points last night to lead Brazil to a 104-90 victory over Mexico in the second round in Las Vegas.Barbosa, the N.B.A.’s Sixth Man of the Year with the Phoenix Suns last season, was 8 for 13 from the field. He fell just short of his tournament average of 23.8 points.Also yesterday, Argentina defeated Canada, 85-70, and Venezuela beat Uruguay, 88-79.The United States, which earned a 127-100 victory against Mexico on Monday night, played Puerto Rico late last night.
